label: 中務省
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: [Also Nakatsukasashō] Most important ministry (shō).  In charge of imperial decrees (senji), etc., advised Sovereign (Tennō) on ceremonial matters, kept lists of th eInner Noblewomen (Naimyōbu), registers of households (koseki) of all the provinces (kuni), of the Buddhist priests (sō) and nuns (ama), of the payments of the tax of rice on paddy fields (so) and tribute in kind (chō); supervised compilation of national histories; acted as intermediary between the Sovereign and the rest of the government.
